Snippet: Ugly Duckling Corp, used car dealer, says it has sold its Cygnet Dealer finance unit to its chairman and principal shareholder, Ernest Garcia, for $17.5 million in cash, $12 million promissory note and assumption of $8 million in debt (S)
LeadParagraph: The Ugly Duckling Corporation, a used car dealer that sells to people with troubled credit histories, said yesterday that it had sold its Cygnet Dealer Finance unit to the company's chairman for about $37.5 million in cash and debt. The company, which is based in Phoenix, said an entity controlled by its chairman and principal shareholder, Ernest Garcia, had bought the unit, which provides financing for small, independent dealers. The transaction consisted of $17.5 million in cash, a $12 million 10-year promissory note backed by Verde Investments Inc. and the assumption of $8 million in debt owed to Verde. Ugly Duckling said it wanted to focus on its used-car dealerships.

Headline.Main: UGLY DUCKLING'S CHAIRMAN BUYS OUT ITS AUTO FINANCE UNIT
